model
Class Partition

java.lang.Object
  model.Partition
All Implemented Interfaces:
IMultiSourceTransition<SystemState<Partition>>, INode<Partition>, ISuccessorProvider<Partition>, ITransition<SystemState<Partition>>
public class Partition
extends java.lang.Object
implements IMultiSourceTransition<SystemState<Partition>>, INode<Partition>, ISuccessorProvider<Partition>

Implements a partition in a partition graph. Partitions are nodes, but they do not explictly represent their edges. Instead, they know the MessageEvents they contain, and generate the edges on the fly using existential abstraction. The class is complicated by the fact that in the state based view, each partition corresponds to possibly several transitions. The implementation here can only handle state based views where a partition corresponds to a set of transitions that all have the same target (but possibly different sources).

Author:
sigurd

getTransitionsIterator

public IterableIterator<Relation<Partition>> getTransitionsIterator(java.lang.String act)
Generate Edges on the fly. We examine all contained messages and find the appropriate successor messages. We then check to which partition the successor messages belong and create an edge between the partitions. Duplicates are eliminated.

Specified by:
getTransitionsIterator in interface INode<Partition>
Returns:
an IterableIterator over all outgoing transitions of this node
